Category One Description:
*****************See RFP for all Details *********************************************** 
Internet Access: 
Plumas Lake Elementary School District hereafter referred to as Applicant, is requesting proposals for leased lit fiber (with or without Internet access) for delivery of wide area network (WAN) services to the district. Service is expected to originate at the district hub site and be delivered to the eligible service locations. All locations, with addresses, are listed in the attached pricing sheet. The new service is being planned to begin on July 1, 2019 which represents the expiration of the current WAN service.
Applicant is seeking bids for a fully managed WAN solution. Leased Lit Fiber (with or without Internet Access) is the E-rate Category 1 service option to choose when bidding point to point wide area network (WAN) connections.  WAN connections do not connect to an Internet access point.   WAN connections are point-to-point fiber connections that connect individual instructional/non-instructional facilities in the same school district. 
Network Design and Construction Routes -
a.	Applicant will consider traditional network designs (such as hub and spoke) or alternative proposals. The applicantâ€™s stated decision criteria (outlined in the RFP) will be used to determine if an award is made as-a-result of this RFP.  The applicant has, in accordance with E-rate guidelines, rated cost of service as the highest weighted factor in its decision criteria.
b.	Due to current and future bandwidth needs, respondents are encouraged to provide dedicated infrastructure to Applicant. Designs are encouraged to utilize the private fiber approach, where there exists no other aggregation or third-party equipment on fiber strands between sites and modulating equipment at each site is dedicated to Applicant and not shared in any way with other customers. If this is not possible, then designs should limit the use of shared infrastructure as much as possible.	
c.   Respondents should clearly illustrate proposed network design and construction routes. 
d.	Applicant is not advocating or mandating any preconceived network design or construction route and leaves this decision up to the vendor to present their best solution while recognizing the cited termination locations.

Nodal WAN connection between all sites â€“ 1G with the ability for all sites to talk to each other.
No internet access is required as it is being provided to the District Office through Yuba City at no cost to the applicant.

Bidders shall offer Month-to-Month and multi-year contract options with no more than 3 years preferred. Three-year contract desirable with annual option to renew for up to two additional years. 
Bidders shall offer pricing in 100Mbps increments up to 2G.  Contract must allow for upgrades to quoted bandwidth.  
Proposals not offering all service speeds requested will be disqualified. 
Bidders shall quote all applicable charges including taxes, surcharges and other fees. 
Bids must identify the estimated cost for all non-recurring expenses, including but not limited to site surveys, project management, documentation, installation, configuration, taxes, etc. Prices must be broken down into eligible and ineligible charges.

IMPORTANT INSTRUCTIONS: Quantities are estimates and may increase or decrease over the term of the awarded contract.  Due to the way EPC has been created with the service category questions please consider information drafted into quantities as educated estimates for the issuance of this Form 470.    Please reference the attached RFP for more information and specifications.  All questions concerning this RFP shall be submitted in writing by email to Neale Aulakh, Director of Technology, at neale_aulakh@busdk12.com on or before January 13, 2025, at 2:00 PM. PST. Please indicate the RFP title in the subject line.  All notices, clarifications, and addenda to this RFP shall be posted on the District website at www.busdk12.com/departments/business-services/purchasing-warehouse-printshop/projects and USACs EPC Portal https://forms.universalservice.org/portal/. *Please follow this 470 to receive all informational updates. Sealed proposals shall be delivered and addressed to Barstow Unified School District, 551 South Avenue H, Barstow, CA 92311, Attn: T. Castelli, Director, Purchasing and Warehouse no later than January 21, 2025, at 2:00 p.m. PST and properly labeled: BID #25-030 E-rate Category 2. Proposals received after the stated deadline of January 21, 2025, at 2:00 p.m. PST will not be accepted and will be considered non-responsive. Applicant may consider multi-year and/or contracts with voluntary extensions. Any voluntary contract extensions must be identified within the awarded contract and must be of a specified number and duration. Contracts with automatic or evergreen contract extension terms will not be considered. Applicant may consider contracts with flexible terms to allow for growth/reduction in services to accommodate an increase/decrease in the number of sites, users, and/or bandwidth. Service Providers submitting proposals in response to this FCC Form 470 must be in compliance with the rules and orders governed by the Federal Communications Commission. Failure to be in compliance and remain in compliance may result in the denial of discount funding, and/or cancellation of funding commitments and/or contracts, and/or could result in civil or criminal prosecution by law enforcement authorities. Should the Service Provider fail to invoice USAC timely, Applicant will only be responsible for paying its non-discounted share. The Service Provider acknowledges that all pricing and technology infrastructure information in its contract shall be considered as public and non-confidential pursuant to CFR Part 54 Section 504 (2)(i)(ii).

REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS for materials & services specified in this Form 470 & associated documents.    Contacting the Districts staff is restricted to instructions in Terms & Conditions of posted RFP & any Addenda.    In accordance with School District Procurement Rules in AZ Administrative Code (A.C.C.) promulgated by State Board of Education pursuant to A.R.S. 15-213, proposals for the materials/services specified will be received by the applicant, at the specified online portal, until time & date cited. Proposals received by correct time & date will be opened & the name of each offeror shall be publicly read. Late proposals shall not be considered by statute. Proposals must be submitted electronically in the district's online portal at https://maranausd.ionwave.net.    Instructions for preparing the proposal are provided within the Terms & Conditions of the posted RFP & any Addendums. Proposals that dont conform to these instructions, or any proposal that is generic in nature/otherwise does not meet the requirements of this Form 470 & associated specifications, may be considered non-responsive & may be disqualified.    All original contracts offered for less than a 60-month term should allow for annual 1 year extensions and/or month to month extensions at the discretion of the applicant; not to exceed a total of 60 months. OFFERORS ARE STRONGLY ENCOURAGED TO CAREFULLY READ THE ENTIRE RFP.    Any pricing proposed must comply w/ the FCC Lowest Corresponding Price Rule as required by the Universal Service First Report and Order, & restated in the FCC E-Rate Modernization Report & Order, adopted 7/11/14.  The FCC LCP rule prohibits an E-rate services offeror from offering/charging E-rate applicants a price higher than the lowest price that the offeror charges to non-residential customers who are similarly situated to a particular school, library, rural health care provider/consortium that purchase directly from offeror.

may also purchase equipment and services under publicly bid centralized procurement contracts administered by the
New York State Office of General Services, New York State counties, National Cooperative Bids and Federal GSA
purchase contracts in which permitted by law to participate, or awarded bid contracts issued/administered by OCM
BOCES. Bid will be considered invalid if Purchasing policy is not met. Please note the certification required by FCC/
Erate that there are no components or hardware requested or funded for Huawei and/or ZTE equipment and services.
PURPOSE: The purpose of this worksheet is to request price quotes for networking equipment and components from
vendors with valid contracts as outlined above. FOR EACH ITEM, vendors must list a valid CONTRACT NUMBER
in the space provided. Items without a valid contract will be disqualified from bidding. Quantities are estimated. Actual
purchases may vary from the quantity listed for any item. Pricing supplied will be considered a FIRM UNIT COST
regardless of actual quantity purchased at any one time.
SUBMISSION: The completed EXCEL VERSION OF THIS WORKSHEET in its entirety and native format must be
emailed to kwojslaw@cnyric.org by the Allowable Contract Date listed on the corresponding Form 470. In addition to
this worksheet response, please include all WEBSITE LINKS to any OGS and other referenced contracts in the body of
your email. Please contact kwojslaw@cnyric.org with any questions or issues regarding this worksheet.
INSTRUCTIONS FOR COMPLETING THE WORKSHEET:
1. MAKE NO CHANGES TO THE BODY OF THE WORKSHEET (COLUMNS A THROUGH N; ROWS
1THROUGH 35. (See OTHER INFORMATION below.)
2. If quoting item exactly as referenced in Columns B and D, enter YES in Column F; otherwise, enter NO and list
Manufacturer, Model/Part Number and Model Name/Description of equipment in Columns L through N. Items that
cannot be found on the referenced contract may be disregarded by the applicant in its bid analysis.
3. Provide the FIRM E-RATE UNIT COST in Column G and the percentage of the item eligible for E-rate support in
Column H. The dollar amount of the item eligible for E-rate support is calculated in Column I. See Sample Item on Row
37.
4. Provide the OGS Contract Number in Column J. If not OGS, provide the Contract Name and Number in Column K.
Provide a WEBSITE LINK to the OGS and any other referenced contract in the body of your email submission.
5. At the bottom of this worksheet (ROW 51), provide the name and title of the person acknowledging columns H and
I contain accurate eligibility information for each item bid and there are no Huawei and/or ZTE equipment and services
included.
OTHER INFORMATION:
At the end of the equipment list is an area for ALTERNATE BIDS & ADDITIONAL OPTIONS. Additions will be
treated as individual ALTERNATE BIDS and may/may not be considered.
State or Local Restrictions Description: Public work and purchase contracts for public schools in New York State are governed by the provisions of Section 103, 104 and 105 of the State's General Municipal Law and individual school district purchasing policy. Public schools may also purchase equipment and services under publicly bid centralized procurement contracts administered by the New York State Office of General Services, New York State counties, applicable Federal GSA purchase contracts when legally allowed, and awarded bid contracts administered by the local boards of cooperative educational services (BOCES) where an eligible entity is a participant in that cooperative bid. Service providers must be in compliance with all E-rate rules, including Lowest Corresponding Price (LCP). Bid will be considered invalid if Purchasing policy is not met. All questions/responses must be submitted in writing. Always reference the Form 470 number when responding to this posting.

State or Local Restrictions Description: A Colorado constitutional amendment prohibits public schools and libraries from entering into multiple-year financial obligations, such as multi-year contracts, without pre-allocation of the funds unless the local voters have previously approved such an obligation. [Colo. Const. Article X, Section 20(4)(b)] However, funding agreements, including multi-year contracts, that are subject to annual appropriations by a governing board, such as a school board, generally are allowed and are not subject to this constitutional provision since the governing board decides each year to make a particular expenditure.

Form Nickname: PLEASE DISREGARD FORM - NEW FORM WILL BE CREATED
Category One Description:
Technology Leadership High School is seeking proposals for internet access service at speeds ranging from 1Gbps-5Gbps with IP Addresses. Given the continuing development of a statewide network, bidders should include multiple contract length and billing options to afford the school maximum flexibility. Thus, we are requesting bid offers for 1-year contracts, traditional multi-year contracts, multi-year contracts with yearly renewal options, and month-to-month agreements.

All bid/proposals must include all costs associated with delivering service to the school, including installation charges (non-recurring charges), special construction, leased customer premise equipment and estimated taxes and fees.
	Any special construction charges shall be separated from the monthly charges. This does NOT include charges for basic installation.
	Any non-recurring charges (NRC) shall also be separated from the monthly recurring. This includes installation, provisioning, equipment leases, etc. 
	Estimated charges for taxes and fees (separated).


All bid responses or questions should be sent to erateconsulting@solixinc.com. Responses that are not sent to this address will not be considered.  Although not a mandatory requirement, service providers should indicate if they are willing to invoice USAC directly, providing the school with the applicable discounts on their monthly billing.  The email subject of your response should be titled with the schools name and Form 470 # for which you are bidding; responses without this subject will not be considered.
